block.p: Sheila Jane Ohlsson, the daughter of Mariza B. Ohlsson of Seattle and Dr. John T. Ohlsson of Denver, was married yesterday to William Mallory Walker, a son of Diana H. Walker and O. Mallory Walker Jr. of Washington. Lea Flocchini, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the bridegroom's family's home in Sun Valley, Idaho.

Mrs. Walker, 34, is a chartered financial analyst. Until May, she was the senior director of the World netLiteracy Foundation, which was a nonprofit program of netLibrary.com, an electronic library and provider of library services to businesses, based in Boulder. She has also been a mutual-fund portfolio manager, and worked until 1998 at the Berger Funds in Denver. She graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder, where her father is a professor of biochemistry. Her mother is a membership development associate for the Seattle Chamber of Commerce.

Sheila Jane Ohlsson, the daughter of Mariza B. Ohlsson of Seattle and Dr. John T. Ohlsson of Denver, was married yesterday to William Mallory Walker, a son of Diana H. Walker and O. Mallory Walker Jr. of Washington. Lea Flocchini, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the bridegroom's family's home in Sun Valley, Idaho.

Mrs. Walker, 34, is a chartered financial analyst. Until May, she was the senior director of the World netLiteracy Foundation, which was a nonprofit program of netLibrary.com, an electronic library and provider of library services to businesses, based in Boulder. She has also been a mutual-fund portfolio manager, and worked until 1998 at the Berger Funds in Denver. She graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder, where her father is a professor of biochemistry. Her mother is a membership development associate for the Seattle Chamber of Commerce.

Mr. Walker, 33, is the senior vice president for strategy and business development at TeleTech Services Corporation, a business in Denver that manages customer service and e-mail for other companies. He graduated from St. Lawrence University and received an M.B.A. from Harvard University. His mother is a White House photographer for Time magazine. His father is the president of Walker & Dunlop, a mortgage banking and corporate real estate company in Washington.
